bergmark_d wrote:
> Heritrixers, I can control my curiosity no longer.  Why the 
> name, "ToeThreads"??

While the mascots of web crawlers have usually been spider-related,
I'd rather think of Heritrix as a centipede or millipede: fast and
many-segmented.

Anything that "crawls" over many things at once would presumably have
a lot of feet and toes. Heritrix will often use many hundreds of worker
threads to "crawl", but 'WorkerThread' or 'CrawlThread' seem mundane.

So instead, we have 'ToeThreads'. :)

- Gordon @ IA
